extraHeader.label: Extra Header Field (empty to not show

skill.label: Skill
skill.tooltip: Skill to roll for the chat window (usually opposed effects)

isMelee.label: Melee
isMelee.hint: Used for CWN armor and melee weapons

swnr.title: Stars Without Number: Revised

administer.name: Administer
administer.text: Manage an organization, handle paperwork, analyze records, and keep an institution functioning on a daily basis. Roll it for bureaucratic expertise, organizational management, legal knowledge, dealing with government agencies, and understanding how institutions really work.

connect.name: Connect
connect.text: Find people who can be helpful to your purposes and get them to cooperate with you. Roll it to make useful connections with others, find people you know, know where to get illicit goods and services, and be familiar with foreign cultures and languages. You can use it in place of Talk for persuading people you find via this skill.

exert.name: Exert
exert.text: Apply trained speed, strength, or stamina in some feat of physical exertion. Roll it to run, jump, lift, swim, climb, throw, and so forth. You can use it as a combat skill when throwing things, though it doesn’t qualify as a combat skill for other ends.

fix.name: Fix
fix.text: Create and repair devices both simple and complex. How complex will depend on your character’s background; a lostworlder blacksmith is going to need some study time before he’s ready to fix that broken fusion reactor, though he can do it eventually. Roll it to fix things, build things, and identify what something is supposed to do.

heal.name: Heal
heal.text: Employ medical and psychological treatment for the injured or disturbed. Roll it to cure diseases, stabilize the critically injured, treat psychological disorders, or diagnose illnesses.

know.name: Know
know.text: Know facts about academic or scientific fields. Roll it to understand planetary ecologies, remember relevant history, solve science mysteries, and know the basic facts about rare or esoteric topics.

lead.name: Lead
lead.text: Convince others to also do whatever it is you’re trying to do. Talk might persuade them that following you is smart, but Lead can make them do it even when they think it’s a bad idea. Roll it to lead troops in combat, convince others to follow you, or maintain morale and discipline.

notice.name: Notice
notice.text: Spot anomalies or interesting facts about your environment. Roll it for searching places, detecting ambushes, spotting things, and reading the emotional state of other people.

perform.name: Perform
perform.text: Exhibit some performative skill. Roll it to dance, sing, orate, act, or otherwise put on a convincing or emotionally moving performance.

pilot.name: Pilot
pilot.text: Use this skill to pilot vehicles or ride beasts. Roll it to fly spaceships, drive vehicles, ride animals, or tend to basic vehicle repair. This skill doesn’t help you with things entirely outside the scope of your background or experience, though with some practice a PC can expand their expertise.

program.name: Program
program.text: Operating or hacking computing and communications hardware. Roll it to program or hack computers, control computer-operated hardware, operate communications tech, or decrypt things.

punch.name: Punch
punch.text: Use it as a combat skill when fighting unarmed. If your PC means to make a habit of this rather than as a recourse of desperation, you should take the Unarmed Combatant focus described later.

shoot.name: Shoot
shoot.text: Use it as a combat skill when using ranged weaponry, whether hurled rocks, bows, laser pistols, combat rifles, or ship’s gunnery.

sneak.name: Sneak
sneak.text: Move without drawing notice. Roll it for stealth, disguise, infiltration, manual legerdemain, pickpocketing, and the defeat of security measures.

stab.name: Stab
stab.text: Use it as a combat skill when wielding melee weapons, whether primitive or complex.

survive.name: Survive
survive.text: Obtain the basics of food, water, and shelter in hostile environments, along with avoiding their natural perils. Roll it to handle animals, navigate difficult terrain, scrounge urban resources, make basic tools, and avoid wild beasts or gangs.

talk.name: Talk
talk.text: Convince other people of the facts you want them to believe. What they do with that conviction may not be completely predictable. Roll it to persuade, charm, or deceive others in conversation.

trade.name: Trade
trade.text: Find what you need on the market and sell what you have. Roll it to sell or buy things, figure out where to purchase hard-to-get or illicit goods, deal with customs agents, or run a business.

work.name: Work
work.text: This is a catch-all skill for professions not represented by other skills. Roll it to work at a particular profession, art, or trade

administer.name: Administer
administer.text: Manage an organization, handle paperwork, analyze records, and keep an institution functioning on a daily basis. Roll it for bureaucratic expertise, organizational management, legal knowledge, dealing with government agencies, and understanding how institutions really work.

connect.name: Connect
connect.text: Find people who can be helpful to your purposes and get them to cooperate with you. Roll it to make useful connections with others, find people you know, know where to get illicit goods and services, and be familiar with foreign cultures and languages. You can use it in place of Talk for persuading people you find via this skill.

drive.name: Drive
drive.text: Drive vehicles, sail ships, fly planes, pilot drones, and perform maintenance and basic repairs on such devices. A PC’s background may incline them to a particular kind of driving, but with some practice this skill can be applied generally.

exert.name: Exert

Roll it to fix things, build things, and identify what something is supposed to do.

shoot.text: Use it as a combat skill when using ranged weaponry, whether hurled rocks, bows, laser pistols, combat rifles, or ship’s gunnery.

sneak.name: Sneak

stab.name: Stab
stab.text: Use it as a combat skill when wielding melee weapons, whether primitive or complex.

talk.name: Talk
talk.text: Convince other people of the facts you want them to believe. What they do with that conviction may not be completely predictable. Roll it to persuade, charm, or deceive others in conversation.

trade.name: Trade
trade.text: Find what you need on the market and sell what you have. Roll it to sell or buy things, figure out where to purchase hard-to-get or illicit goods, deal with customs agents, or run a business.

work.name: Work
work.text: This is a catch-all skill for professions not represented by other skills. Roll it to work at a particular profession, art, or trade

biopsionics.name: Biopsionics
biopsionics.text: Master powers of physical repair, body augmentation, and shapeshifting.

metapsionics.name: Metapsionics
metapsionics.text: Master powers that nullify, boost, and shape the use of other psychic abilities.

precognition.name: Precognition
precognition.text: Master the ability to sense future events and control probability.

telekinesis.name: Telekinesis
telekinesis.text: Master the remote control of kinetic energy to move objects and fabricate force constructs.

telepathy.name: Telepathy
telepathy.text: Master the reading and influencing of other sapient minds.

teleportation.name: Teleportation
teleportation.text: Master the arts of physical translocation of yourself and allies.

sheet.modModifierHint: The change to the modifier. Breaks the +/- 2 limit
sheet.name: Name
sheet.loadSkills: No skills? Click here to add some!
sheet.hd: Hit Dice per level (without CON mod)
sheet.rest-desc: Apply a good night's rest (reset effort, drop strain, heal HP)?

drone.name: Drone Name
drone.fitTip: CWN uses hardpoints for weapons. If hardpoint max > 0, the system will count ship/vehicle weapons and weapons against hardpoints and not fittings.

faction.abandonGoal: Abandon current goal {name}? Will lose income and no actions this turn/

addBaseDialog.title: Add New Base
addBaseDialog.content:
Adding a new base from Expand Influence Action.
Select HP (up to Faction max HP).
One FacCred per HP.
addBaseDialog.label: Base HP
addBaseDialog.baseHpTooHigh: Error: HP of new base ({baseHp}) cannot be greater than faction HP ({factionHp})}
addBaseDialog.notEnoughFacCredsForBase: Error: HP of new base ({baseHp}) cannot be greater than facCreds ({facCreds})

editTagDialog.noName: Error: Tag name cannot be empty

editLogDialog.label:
Manual log entry.
To inline a roll use [[1dX]].

faction.tagIndexInvalid: Error: Faction tag index {index} is invalid

ship.calc-cost-hint: Calculate the cost for the ship (using hull and items)
ship.make-payment-hint: Make a payment using ship's pool.  Note: If simple-calendar module is installed, travel and schedule will integrate automatically.
ship.pay-maintenance-hint: Pay maintenance (using ship's pool)  Note: If simple-calendar module is installed, travel and schedule will integrate automatically.
ship.name: Name

settings.useRollNPCHD: Use NPC HD on token create?
settings.useRollNPCHDHint: When creating a npc token, if the HP or Hit Dice (HD) has not been rolled, it will roll d8 HD for health automatically.
settings.useHomebrewLuckSaveHint: Uses 16 - Level for the save, no modifiers, just pure luck
settings.addShockMessageHint: When attacking this adds another roll for shock damage in the attack chat message.
settings.showTempAttrModHint: On the character sidebar show the temporary modifiers to an attribute (e.g. attribute damage)
settings.attrRollHint: What action/roll, if any, to take on an stat roll/click?
settings.useTraumaHint: Use CWN trauma dice for rolling attacks?
settings.useStressHint: Use AWN stress attribute for characters?
settings.useCWNArmorHint: Use CWN armor options (soak, melee and ranged AC)?
settings.useCWNCyberHint: Use CWN cyber options (concealment, type, complications, etc)?
settings.showAccessHint: Show Access on the character sheet?
settings.searchHint: What compendiums to search for items for in-sheet item adds?
settings.languagePresetSelectorHint: Select a preset to add to your language list. Use the button below to add the selected preset languages to your available languages list.
settings.availableLanguagesHint: Comma-separated list of languages available to characters. Edit this list freely to add, remove, or modify languages for your world.
settings.showTempPoolModifiersHint: Show temporary modifier input boxes for resource pools in the Powers tab. Allows manual adjustment of pool values and maximums.

healthButtons.fullDamage: Apply full damage to selected token(s)
healthButtons.halfDamage: Apply half damage to selected token(s)
healthButtons.fullHealing: Apply full healing to selected token(s)
healthButtons.fullDamageModified: Apply full damage with modifier to selected token(s)

spike.fail3: Catastrophic dimensional energy incursion.  Ship emerges around a star within 1d6 hexes  of the target destination with drive and all systems destroyed.
spike.fail4-5: Shear surge overwhelms internal systems. Ship emerges around star nearest to drill origin. 50% chance for each system to be disabled until repaired. If the spike drive is disabled, treat as if a 3 were rolled.
spike.fail6-8: Power spike. One system disabled until repaired, ship stuck in transit for full  base time before being able to make another Pilot check. If the spike drive fails, treat as if a 3 were rolled.
spike.fail9-12: Ship off course. Spend base time in transit, then make another Pilot check.
spike.fail13-15: Ship off course, but detected early. Make another Pilot check.
spike.fail16-17: Drill successful, but takes twice base time
spike.fail18: Drill successful and on time, by blind luck.

weapon.ammotNotFound: No matching ammo found in inventory
weapon.remember: Remember these settings (do not ask again, reset in edit)

pools.title: Resource Pools
pools.poolsGrantedHint: Resource pools are granted by Features, Foci, and Edges. Check the Features tab to configure pool grants.

failure.what:
What to fail?
(disabling/breaking an already disabled system will destroy it)

tweak.extra-effort-name: Extra Effort Name (leave blank to not show on sheet)
tweak.show-resource-list: On the combat tab, show optional resource tracking.  This allows you to add an arbitrary resource that tracks a value and max (just 2 numbers really) with  a customized name. You can delete these attributes  from the list.

hp.title: Confirm rolling level hit dice for {actor}.
hp.text: Confirm rolling {level} level hit dice for {actor}. Each level HD (includes CON mod) is {formula}, where max means taking the higher of the roll with modifiers or 1 (note this is not a fractional number like 0.1). This action will set the HP to the roll results or the current HP + 1, whatever is larger. To change the hitdie see the stats tab.

roll.skillNeeded: Hey! You need to pick a skill!

migration.start: SWNR: Starting migration from {oldVersion} to {newVersion}. Please let this finish before closing.
migration.needsGM: SWNR: A GM needs to log in to do run {count} migrations from {oldVersion} to {newVersion}!

swnr.deleteCrew: Do you want to remove {name} from the crew?
swnr.deletePilot: Do you want to remove {name} as the pilot?
swnr.deleteContent: Are you sure you want to delete {name} from the actor {actor}? (hold shift to skip confirm dialog)

selectDialog.title: Select Consumables
selectDialog.notEnough: You must select the required amount
selectDialog.noneAvailable: No readied consumables with sufficient uses available
